Literature Review: Noncentrosymmetric (NCS) materials have garnered significant attention in recent years due to their unique properties, including nonlinear optical (NLO) responses and topological spin textures, known as skyrmions. The design principles underlying these materials are crucial for harnessing their functionalities. This review aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the design principles for NCS materials, focusing on NLO materials and magnetic skyrmions. We will discuss the atomic-scale precision, structural customization, and electronic tunability required for these materials, as well as the current state of research in this field.
